subject: Technology
title: RAM: Your Computer's Short-Term Memory
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on RAM: Your Computer's Short-Term Memory.

hook.text: Open too many browser tabs and your computer slows to a crawl. Blame your RAM.

buildup.text: RAM is temporary memory. It holds whatever you're actively working on right now.

discovery.text: RAM is incredibly fast because it stores data electrically, not mechanically. No moving parts.

twist.text: The downside: RAM forgets everything the instant you lose power. It is completely volatile.

climax.text: That's why unsaved work vanishes in a power outage. RAM only remembers while the electricity flows.

punchline.text: RAM is fast but forgetful. Save your work.

quiz.question: What happens to data in RAM when power is lost?
options: It transfers to the hard drive
